answerText: Somdet Phra Narai[10] Narai was one of the greatest rulers of this kingdom. It was ruled by two Uthong and two Suphannaphum dynasties, lasted from around 1350 to 1750, and was originally based in the Chao Phraya River valley.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 2 | 9 | History | World | College
subject: History
question: Question: This ruler ordered a palace built at Lopburi, and he was succeeded by Phra Phetracha upon his death, much to his dismay, and Phetracha severed many of the connections with the west that he had tried to build.Â For 10 points each: [10] Name this monarch whose longtime aid and advisor, Constantine Phaulkon, oversaw the reaction to the killing of several British people in the Mergui Massacre.
